description: anthropo- +‎ -phobia. Both elements are borrowed from Ancient Greek ἄνθρωπος (ánthrōpos, “man, human”) + φόβος (phóbos, “fear”) respectively.

entries.meaning: A profound fear of human beings, or of human society.
examples: The affection is unlike anthropophobia, because this is characterized by dislike of men, and decided aversion to sexual intercourse.
